reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: I read some negative reviews on this item, and I was a bit surprised at some of the comments. This switch was super easy to install, and as soon as I powered it up, Alexa discovered and configured it. On the electrical side of the install you need to be able to turn off the breaker in the panel, remove the old switch, connect the wires, and screw the switch into the wall box - this is a process that you’ll need to do with any switch. It’s a great product, and it reasonably priced. 5 STARS!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2025
reviews.title: Great Product

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: Instability like no other! Constantly disconnects then reconnects to the WiFi when it decides to. This is unreliable so it leads me to being unable to reliably use my automation. My router is properly set up and is <1 year old so I know it's not my router having these issues.

reviews.title: Unstable Connection to WiFi

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: This is cheap and easy to install, but garbage. With standard LED light bulbs, it will slightly dim then brighten them about every 10-15 seconds. When I tell Alexa to wake me up at a certain time, it will often turn these lights on by itself. It also randomly turns the lights off. Absolute waste of money and will be replaced asap.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2025
reviews.title: Junk. Has a mind of its own.

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: Switch died after 1 month and 2 days (stuck in the "on" position and won't turn off), and it was a real battle to get a refund. I still have to hire an electrician to come take out the broken switch. Update: about a month later, while I was on vacation, my AT&T internet went out for about 3 days. When I got home, 5 of the 7 switches I had were also "dead" (I couldn't turn them off or on at the switch). Thankfully I was able to reset them by resetting the main breaker to the circuits these switches were on, but that is totally unacceptable to have to turn off the power to be able to use these as "dumb" switches. If this keeps happening, I'm going to need to hire an electrician again to come take all these pieces of junk out, and replace with some better smart switches. I'm really disappointed because I always thought the Amazon Basic brand was pretty good. I can't really recommend these switches to anyone. Would give 0 stars if I could.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2025
reviews.title: Broke after 1 month.

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: For some reason this switch gets a bad reputation and I have no idea why. This was my 4th smart switch and the only one that’s never given me an issue. I run a high network Asus Mesh network and when I replaced it I was worried even with the tri-channel I’d have issues connecting to the 2.4ghz network. Connected flawlessly and I’ve never had a single issue with it. Even after nearly 2 years. It’s been connected and running its routine with no issues. I honestly think the people that have issues either has a 5ghz network only, a cheap “smart” network that isn’t picking up 2.4ghz or didn’t install it correctly. It’s been the only smart switch that I’m willing to order.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2025
reviews.title: When installed correctly with proper network settings. WORKS GREAT!

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: I love these switches! Have about 10 in the house. They connect automatically to alexa and can be controlled from anywhere. You can also create routines for the lights to go on on and off on a schedule. Easy to wire ( black is power and red goes to the fixture) a little bit more space is needed in the box for the extra wire- in an exostong box, you need to work carefully amd smartly. In a new box, easier just to get a bigger box from the beginning. A plus in my book
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025
reviews.title: Love these things

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: I installed one of these in a four gang configuration. Unfortunately, the Amazon basics product is only made to be used with the one gang configuration. I had to shove my four gang switch cover onto the four gang switch cover holder because the Amazon basics switch is much thicker than a normal switch. Notice the gap in the picture where the Amazon basic switch is located. The gap is because of the thickness of the Amazon Basics product. If you plan on installing this in a two or more gang switch cover configuration, you may want to go with a different product. The product receives five stars as a singular installation.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2025
reviews.title: Only made to work with 1 gang Amazon switch cover

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: It seems to work great as a standalone unit or for a single owner. But if you have an Amazon household setup and you need to share devices with them, this will not work. For some reason they sent this to Market without adding an ability to share the device with others in a single household. For me that is a huge problem so I will not be using this as an alternative to the Kasa switches and others which can be shared by linking with third-party skills. Come on amazon, get this working with a connected household!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2025
reviews.title: Can not be remotely shared with other household members

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: I've seen a few reviews stating they have issue with the switch not working properly with routines and or it stating not responding. I had the same issue, but I found my router to be the issue. If you have a lot of wifi devices these switches tend to not be handled good by a cheap router. Check your router device capacity. I upgraded to a mesh and made a world of a difference. My household has about 80 devices connected to wifi at any given time. Only time these switches don't work is when my internet goes out. I have about 30 of these switches, ranging from 3 way, dimmable and single pole. All work without a flaw and respond perfectly to routines. Highly recommend.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2025
reviews.title: Having issues with routines and or "not responding" on Alexa app? Read my review

reviews.title: Be sure the wiring in the switch location is adequate

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: The smart switch was working fine until we had a power outage. Once the power came back on, this was the only smart switch that did not work. There was power to the switch because the indicator light was on, but it would not turn on the light it was connected to. The other switches next to this one worked fine. I tried resetting the switch, but it would not reset. I removed the Amazon Basics smart switch and installed a regular switch. The connected light turned back on with the regular switch. This was the only Amazon Basics smart switch I had installed in the house while all the other ones were the Feit smart switches. There were no problems with the Feit switches when the power came back on.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2024
reviews.title: Okay until the first power outage

reviews.productTitle: Amazon Basics Smart Switch, Single Pole, Works with Alexa Only, 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, No Hub Required, White
reviews.text: Easy to install and setup. But after 3 weeks it began to come on at random times. It appears to be a software issue as it seems to come on when Alexa is activated announcing motion at various cameras installed inside and outside of our home or when the internet has a momentary flash off then on. Ordering another brand product.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024
reviews.title: Comes on at Random
